intro: Diosma vulgaris var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy diosma, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Diosma vulgaris var. hirsuta is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
